column5: Well thanks to Sinker and Big Chev, me and Meely decided to hit Simcoe this morning to try our luck at some Whiteys. We arrived at the launch at 7 am. Our directions were to "look for the boats".....So we looked for them, found them and anchored in 65 FOW. Wind was out of the NW at 15 km/h.....water temp 49 degrees. Dropped our lures in at 7:45 am.........8:30....we had our limits.  The action was non-stop. Wow.....what a day !! Again, we have never really targeted whities during soft water season and it is thanks to Sinker and Big Chev who offered some great advice which paid off LARGE. A BIG Thanks !!  Buckster The guests of honour
congrats...I'll be there early Sunday morning, thanks for posting.
Hurts me to see this post since I just turned down a trip to Simcoe (Sunday). Congrats on the great work.
hey buckstar...love simcoe whitefish...fishe them in the summer as well,,,nice catch..here are some simcoe soft water whitefish
....Bingo, nice haul. I'll be out there tomorrow with the GF and the dog if'n you see me say hello.
Now ya need a Smoker to cook them beauts!
thanks for sharing, some nice looking fish!

Nice haul guys...  The crappie (you know where) probably appreciate the rest...  Uncle Dave is coming here tomorrow  to pick up his boat...maybe get a chance to run over (you know where)...  BTW...Nice avatar pic Tony...catch that one in Pigeon?
Right on fella's!!  Glad to hear you got into some. Easy isn't it?  Sinker
Yup just like ice fishing!  lol.     Yeah Beans me and Meely got that pic trolling for skis on a jake.   Fish was 31" by 17"( no scale but) it had to go 10lbs

Yup just like ice fishing!  lol.     Yeah Beans me and Meely got that pic trolling for skis on a jake.   Fish was 31" by 17"( no scale but) it had to go 10lbs.   Round 2 fellas.......... out the door as we speek!

WTG guys.....Don't you just love it when a plan comes together?.....lol.....TC and tight lines......Chuck.....P.S. We'll be out there today ourselves.....Look for the green and biege Smokercraft......
Nice job Tony. Glad you guys got into them. Sounds like alot of fun, I'm going to have to give it a go sometime.
Nice job on the whities. Different style of fishing and fun to catch.
